messages.message: py3thonistas .. I think we need to set locale to utf-8 in the Dockerfiles for our python services. Py3 tends to read more things as unicode, and that seems to not play well with the default docker lang setting. this blog post kind of explains it https://webkul.com/blog/setup-locale-python3/. I noticed a couple services (ocr-service, webdriver-tasks) do this in their dockerfiles. if it's something all services need, can we add it to the base image? cc @Ashish @dlluncor @Handsome Dave

I think this is particularly relevant with our switch to py3 this UAT, because some errors don't appear when testing locally or with travis (because our machine's lang is set to utf-8), but it does break when you run it inside docker
example Dockerfile with lang set for reference https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/data-services/ocr-services/ocr-service/Dockerfile
That sounds good to me. I actually thought we'd already set the LANG, so would be happy to do that going forward.
do you know where the base docker image is defined / could you update it to have the lang stuff?
if not i can do it this week since this will be an issue when we push to dogfood
Yeah, I've updated the base images before. I'll have a PR for that by tomorrow (sorry, I'm out sick today)
oo no problem! feel better!!! also we can wait until tomorrow to see if others have any objections here
